titles: The New and strange imprisonment of the people called Quakers in the city of Bristol, by nailing them up in their meeting-house the 7th of the   third month, called May, 1682 and the result of the tryal,    upon the pretence of a riot against them : signified by persons of credit, and  immediate sufferers in the said city : to be added to their late distressed     case.
notes: Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Imperfect: cropped, with print show-through and slight loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
